title: slacko64-5.8.6
description:
Slacko64-5.8.6 by 01micko 11 Jan 2014

The torrent contains slacko64-5.8.6.iso, devx and also 2 deltas to upgrade from previous vesion 5.8.5

below is a copy form/more at http://woof-ce.26403.n7.nabble.com/Slacko64-td257.html

===========
This is the second usable build of a 64 bit Puppy from woof-CE!

Get it here

TORRENTS and DELTA files

iso (167M), devx (140M), kernel source and checksums 

It was built with Slackware64-14.0 binaries and other binaries I compiled in Slackware64 (thanks slackware crew) and FatDog64 (many thanks kirk and jamesbond), as well as Slacko64. (Chicken v Egg ) 

Woof is uploaded to my fork. To grab it: 

git clone https://github.com/01micko/woof-CE/tree/latest

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
5.8.6
What it has; 
-geany - rebuilt 
-inkscape - rebuilt 
-mtpaint 
-gpicview 
-firefox 
-sylpheed 
-goffice >abiword,gnumeric 
-leafpad 
-urxvt 
-ffmpeg >mplayer,pmusic-4.2,pburn-4.3.3,etc (note: built ffmpeg with --libdir=/usr/lib64 bur they end up in /usr/lib) 
-k3.12.7 
-*mm libs >gparted 
-xarchive 
-hardinfo (it works from gui until you hit USB, then crashes, crashes from CLI - segfault) 
-full samba-4.13 
-osmo-2.10 
-gnome-mplayer-1.0.8 
-transmission-gtk (2.6.0 --newer require gtk-3 or qt) 
-pcurl-ftp 
-pure-ftpd 
-hiawatha -however pplog is probably broken, needs perl fix, perhaps with devx loaded it may work 
-ntpdate >psync 
-powerapplet_tray 
-other basic stuffs 


What it has NOT; 
-xlockmore - it builds ok but is way to unstable - does someone want to look at this? sources are at bkhome.org/sources/alphabetical 
-homebank 
-flashplayer 
-mpscan (built but missed) 
-bcrypt 
-gphoto libs 
-games 
-pequaliser 
-notecase 
-mp (we do have nano though - I think I prefer nano 
-tas (screeny is there but I have ffmpeg now...) 
-sane and xsane 
-xdelta 
-htop (busybox top is there) 
-pup-kview and pup-sysinfo (oversight) 
-extra boot loaders *** this certainly needs research, and hopefully Iguleder has the answer for UEFI. It's on the TODO... 
-other important stuffs 

bugfixes 
-recompile and upgrade kernel with CONFIG_RTC_CLASS=y (and associated modules) 
 Hopefully this fixes the system time issue. I did notice there is some weirdness though 
-petget fix for XZ 
-usb icon 
-symlink gtkdialog to /usr/sbin (this is annoying as when built properly path is /usr/bin) 
-/etc/profile - LD_LIBRARY_PATH was wrong, have mechanism to go into stock woof, take a look at $lsuffix
